instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message:
I just got in a MacBook Air Early-2014 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that powers on but goes to high RPM fan spin and the light on the charger goes to orange. This happens with AC power adapter and with battery.
No image/backlight on the screen, no chime. There was some corrosion at <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR>. I cleaned it up and replaced it. There was also some corrosion at <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>. I cleaned it up and reflowed it.

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> Measures 3.37v at <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>


Suggestion on where I should begin? Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
[SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: Orange light on charger is normal without battery. USB mouse lighting up when plugged in? Does it do the 3 times on/off thing before staying on?

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: OK thanks. I will check out the mouse tomorrow. It starts up right away when the adapter and stays on until the power is unplugged. It doesn't turn on/off three times, it just turns on and the fan spins high RPM. Will get back with more info when I plug mouse into the USB port.

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: Plugged in USB mouse and there is no light on either port

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: Any history on this machine, liquid? Having CPU Vcore and board not booting is not going to be fun :(

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: User says that there was no liquid but there was some corrosion. I dropped it in the cleaning tank and cleaned it up thoroughly and when I put it back together it boots right up. USB mouse now has light.  The only strange thing is that now it's doing the fan spin 3 times and then starts.  What's that about?  Other than that, seems to be working. I'm letting it run overnight on my bench with grapher to put it through a workout.  Will let you know more! Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: 3 times on/off is normal for these.

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: All working good so far except the battery is now not charging. Looking further into it. Turns out now that the customer tells me that the trackpad hasn't worked. Nothing like getting all of the info so you can actually try to fix the real issues.  Will report back findings related to the no charge on the battery with readings.

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message:
There's a thermal sensor on trackpad.. If it's acting up and not communicating, the fan spins high.

- Disregard as inaccurate! (see below)

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message:
Thermal sensor is ind√©pendant from trackpad. Cable is the first thing to check for corrosion. 

Is the battery recognized in OSX? If PPBUS is at 8.6V without battery it is probably a dead battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: OK thanks for the info. Will check trackpad and cable tmrw.

threads.title: [SOLVED}<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B-No image on screen, high fan spin & orange light on charger
threads.message: OK. I ended up replacing the trackpad and cable and along with the SMD work that I did the customer paid and picked up the laptop.  Many thanks for your help on this forum!
